page.title: 12THE CUMNOCK CARNIVAL
page.content: The Cumnock carnival or fair is held once a year. There are competitions for fancy dressed individuals and lorries. Some streets dress up lorries and enter them for it. The winner for the best dressed lorry was Fenners who were dressed up as the "Adams Family". Some of the floats entered were "The Wizard of Oz" by River View, "Cheers" by the Mercat Inn and "Clowns " by Cumnock Juniors' Social Club. Cumnock annual flower show came up roses on Saturday 17 August 1985 despite a season that has been a gardeners' nightmare. That was the comment of the judges and organisers of the show. Cumnock Junior F.C. got off to a good start to the season by beating Kello Rovers 4-1.
